title: The easiest way to protect your new iPhone 16e
content:
Macworld

A great iPhone needs a great case

Apple’s brand-new iPhone 16e has caused a huge stir in the tech community. Nominally replacing the iPhone SE from 2022, the new handset is far more powerful, has a far newer look, and features a raft of cool features that SE owners could only dream of. That’s the good news. The bad news is that it’s a great deal more expensive.

In short, it needs to be looked after properly. And that means one thing more than any other: a great case. Choose the right case for your iPhone 16e and it will be protected from drop damage, from scratches and dents, and from a costly shattered screen.

In this article we offer some guidance on selecting the perfect case for your brand-new iPhone 16e.

What to look for

The key is to find the right blend of features and benefits.

Physical protection is the primary reason we’re looking for an iPhone case, but it isn’t the only thing we want. We also want a case that looks great, is light and unobtrusive in the hand, is easy to put on and take off (but remains securely attached in use!), and offers an excellent all-round user experience at a good price.

Bonus points if it’s made and sold by a reliable company with a long history in the industry and millions of satisfied customers. After all, we’re relying on this product to look after a $599 phone; it’s vital to find a manufacturer we can depend on.

ESR’s updated cases for the iPhone 16e

One company we’ve written about before in the context of reliable iPhone cases is ESR. Before we get on to the specific cases worth a look for this assignment, it’s worth reminding ourselves of the firm’s pedigree in the field: with more than 25 million products sold and well over half a million 5-star reviews on Amazon, ESR is a dependable source of iPhone cases with a huge amount of experience and expertise.

To celebrate the launch of the iPhone 16e, ESR has announced an edition of its popular Cyber Tough case designed to suit the new handset, alongside a compatible version of the UltraFit screen protector series. Both are worth your consideration.

ESR

The Cyber Tough case delivers astonishing 23-foot drop protection that exceeds military grade by a factor of seven, thanks to its groundbreaking three-layer design: a robust PC backing, a flexible TPE soft shell, and an inner PORON® lining. Your iPhone’s screen, meanwhile, is shielded from scratches and dents thanks to a 1.7mm raised edge, while the camera has its own dedicated 2.4mm guard to keep lenses scratch-free. All this ruggedness, and the case looks good too–and features a powerful magnetic lock for holding your phone to compatible wireless chargers.

For a reliable yet slimmer option, the HaloLock Classic Hybrid Case offers powerful protection and perfect MagSafe compatibility. Its scratch-resistant acrylic back maintains the iPhone 16e’s sleek appearance while providing everyday durability at an affordable price.

The UltraFit screen protector series, meanwhile, are a doddle to apply thanks to the UltraFit tray. It’s an astoundingly simple two-step process that avoids dust and air bubbles: pop your iPhone in the tray and close it, then pull the tab. Voila! Your iPhone’s screen is now protected from external damage, while remaining fully functional.

The UltraFit Armorite Screen Protector provides top-tier protection, delivering peace of mind without the hassle. It’s certified by SGS to withstand drops from up to 6.5 feet, ensuring 8x stronger drop protection than competing brands. The 9H tempered glass offers superior scratch resistance, keeping the iPhone 16e’s screen flawless for up to 3 years.

For a budget-friendly option, the UltraFit Classic Screen Protector offers solid protection from drops up to 1.6 feet. It’s 2x stronger than competing screen protectors while maintaining the same easy installation and superior dust and bubble resistance as the Armorite series.

Other than these excellent products, ESR offers a wide range of cases, screen protectors and other accessories for Apple’s phones and tablets–and those from other companies too. To check out the full range, visit ESR’s official website or Amazon store today.
